channel.title: Dragon Chains on my server make people invisible?
channel.description: Is there any way to fix this? Or do I have to remove Dragon Chains from my server?

item.title: Dragon Chains on my server make people invisible?
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

Well, I was thinking it might have had something to do with the Silab update recently, because normally Silab prevents people from going invisible, it must be able to make it happen as well in my opinion. I’m not blaming Silab or anything though, I just thought it could be a possibility.

Read full topic
item.source: Dragon Chains on my server make people invisible?

item.title: Dragon Chains on my server make people invisible?
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

It’s either a fault within the client, or something has been modified in the client that the server can’t… work with, if you will.

Read full topic
item.source: Dragon Chains on my server make people invisible?

item.title: Dragon Chains on my server make people invisible?
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

I don’t think so, I don’t see anything out of the ordinary, but then again I’m fairly new to this, this is what I see: (none of this stuff is near each other.)

if(removeID == 1215 || removeID == 6739 || removeID == 3140

if(item == 3140 && playerLevel[13] >= 99) {//Chain
return true;
}

addItemToSmith(3140,0,1121,1);

I don’t know if any of that isn’t supposed to be there, but that’s all I find when I search for the ID number. Does something like this make a person invisible? I’m not thinking it does.

No one has an answer?

Read full topic
item.source: Dragon Chains on my server make people invisible?

item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

X F U R Y X:

Same with my server…

What’s even more weird is that it wasn’t doing it until late last night, I’m guessing around midnight or so my time, the whole time before that it worked fine.
